summary: Allow io_wait-based fiber calls within a special unsafe context in the Ruby SDK. Currently blocked by a TODO, this feature would enable controlled I/O operations in workflows similar to the existing illegal_call_tracing_disabled helper.
userImpact: Users who need to perform I/O operations within workflows would have a documented, controlled way to do so through an explicit unsafe context.
proposedFix: Implement Temporalio::Workflow::Unsafe.io_enabled helper that allows io_wait fiber scheduler calls to pass through when enabled, with clear errors when used outside the context.
resolutionDetails: Feature was implemented to allow io_wait fiber calls within an unsafe context similar to illegal_call_tracing_disabled.
keyQuote: Make a new `Temporalio::Workflow::Unsafe.io_enabled` helper (akin to `illegal_call_tracing_disabled`) and if in that context, allow `io_wait` fiber scheduler calls to go through
